text: Tuctopunta (possibly from Quechua tuqtu broody hen, punta peak; ridge; first, before, in front of)David Weber, A Grammar of Huallaga (Huánuco) Quechua, University of California Press, p. 185Vocabulario-Comparativo-Quechua-Ecuator- Quechua-Ancash is a mountain in the Cordillera Blanca in the Andes of Peru. It is located in the Ancash Region, Huaraz Province, Olleros District. Tuctopunta lies northwest of Tuctu and southwest of Uruashraju and Arhuay.http://escale.minedu.gob.pe/documents/10156/1367926/ugel_huaraz.pdf - UGEL map of Huaraz Province (Ancash) == References == Category:Mountains of Peru Category:Mountains of Ancash Region
title: Tuctopunta
